org.hibernate.sql.results.spi

Interface Selectable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    GenericParameter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractParameter, CaseSimpleExpression, LiteralParameter, NamedParameter, PositionalParameter

    public interface Selectable
    Represents something that is selectable at the object level. This is distinctly different from SqlExpressable which represents something selectable at the SQL/JDBC level. Essentially acts as a template (in the pattern sense) for "selections" - represented by DomainResult represented by DomainResult
    "Implementation Note:"
    Generally speaking any query expression is also selectable. However there are 2 exceptions to this: * dynamic-instantiation - this is selectable, but is not a normal expression in that it can only be used as a selection not in other parts of the query - it will never be part of the SQL AST * "navigable reference" - similar to above. we have it implement (Sql)Expression but that should never be part of the AST. It is (atm) an Expression simply so we can have it available to `Navigable#createDomainResult` via `QueryResultCreationContext#selectedExpression` which means it needs to be an Expression. Another option is to use some other contract/interface that allows access to the same info
